hypothesis_content.title: Market Maker Liquidity Provision Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following announcements of market maker liquidity increases (like Crypto.com's recent announcement), when spread tightening (bid-ask) exceeds 15% on major exchanges within 24 hours, entering long on the dominant asset (BTC/ETH) at the next hourly close yields positive alpha over 72 hours, particularly in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Genuine liquidity improvements from market makers reduce transaction costs and facilitate larger institutional flows. The spread tightening without excessive volume surge indicates real infrastructure improvement rather than speculative response. This creates favorable conditions for gradual appreciation.
entry_conditions: Public announcement of market maker liquidity provision increase
Average bid-ask spread tightens by >15% across top-5 exchanges within 24h post-announcement
Volume increases by <50% (ruling out speculative frenzy)
Enter at next hourly close after spread tightening confirmation
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: 72-hour returns are not statistically different from random entries, or spread tightening proves temporary (<48 hours).
